concise_definition: n. 玩笑, 捉弄; adj. 开玩笑的; v. 玩笑, 捉弄

definitions.explanation_en: To speak in a playful or humorous way, often with the intention of teasing or not being taken seriously, especially when saying something that is not true.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以幽默或戏谑的方式说话，通常旨在捉弄他人或不被当真，尤其指说出并非真实的事情。
definitions.example_en: Are you kidding me? You actually thought that was a good idea?
definitions.example_cn: 你是在开玩笑吧？你真觉得这是个好主意？

definitions.explanation_en: To engage in light-hearted banter or teasing, often among friends, without malice or serious intent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以轻松、无恶意的方式与他人开玩笑或调侃，通常发生在朋友之间。
definitions.example_en: We were just kidding around after class — no one was really upset.
definitions.example_cn: 课后我们只是随便闹着玩，没人真生气。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something said or done in a joking manner, not meant to be taken seriously.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某事是开玩笑地说或做的，并非当真。
definitions.example_en: It was just a kidding remark — I didn’t mean it literally.
definitions.example_cn: 那只是句玩笑话，我不是字面意思。

definitions.explanation_en: A playful or humorous statement or action intended to amuse or tease someone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种旨在逗乐或捉弄他人的幽默或戏谑性言语或行为。
definitions.example_en: He told a few kiddings at the party, and everyone laughed.
definitions.example_cn: 他在派对上说了几个玩笑，大家都笑了。

comparison.analysis: “Joking” 与 “kidding” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “joking” 更中性、更广泛，适用于任何幽默表达；而 “kidding” 常带有轻微的捉弄或试探对方反应的意味，语气更口语化、更随意。
“Teasing” (逗弄) 通常带有轻微的挑衅或调侃性质，可能持续较久，有时甚至可能让对方感到不适；而 “kidding” 通常更短暂、更无害，且双方通常都明白是玩笑。
“Mocking” (嘲讽) 是带有贬义的，常含有轻蔑、侮辱或贬低的意图，情感色彩负面；而 “kidding” 是善意的、非攻击性的，通常建立在彼此信任或亲密关系之上。
